    • Field Detail

      • id

        public String id
        Unique identifier of this connection

      • remoteAddress

        public String remoteAddress
        Last known IP address of the client.

      • remotePort

        public int remotePort
        Last known port number of the client.

      • headers

        public Map<String,String> headers
        Hash containing various headers copied from last request received on this connection. Exposed headers include: `origin`, `referer` and `x-forwarded-for` (and friends), all lowercase. This explicitly does not grant access to the `cookie` header, as using it may easily lead to security issues (for details read the section "Authorisation" at https://github.com/sockjs/sockjs-node).

      • url

        public String url
        The entire url string copied from the last request.

      • pathname

        public String pathname
        `pathname` from parsed url, for convenience.

      • prefix

        public String prefix
        Prefix of the url on which the request was handled. For SockJsServlet, this is the servlet's context path

      • protocol

        public String protocol
        Protocol used by the connection. Keep in mind that some protocols are indistinguishable - for example "xhr-polling" and "xdr-polling".

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • write

        public boolean write(String message,
            boolean async)
        Sends a message over the opened connection. A message must be a non-empty string. It's illegal to send a message after the connection was closed (either after 'close' or 'end' method or 'close' event).
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure

      • end

        public void end()
        Asks the remote client to disconnect with default 'code' and 'reason' values.

      • end

        public void end(String message)
        Write a message and then ask the remote client to disconnect with default 'code' and 'reason' values.
        Parameters:
        message - message to write

      • close

        public boolean close()
        Ask the remote client to disconnect with default 'code' and 'reason' values
        Returns:
        false if the connection was already closed, true otherwise

      • close

        public boolean close(int code,
            String reason)
        Asks the remote client to disconnect with the given 'code' and 'reason' values
        Parameters:
        code - The code, typically one of CloseReason.CloseCodes.getCode()
        reason - A string describing the reason for closure
        Returns:
        false if the connection was already closed, true otherwise

      • destroy

        public void destroy()

      • onData

        public void onData(SockJsConnection.OnDataHandler onDataHandler)
        Called for every message received from a client
        Parameters:
        onDataHandler - The handler to call when messages arrive

      • emitData

        public void emitData(String message)

      • onClose

        public void onClose(SockJsConnection.OnCloseHandler onCloseHandler)
        Called when a connection to a client is closed. This is triggered exactly once for every connection.
        Parameters:
        onCloseHandler - The handler to call when a connection is closed

      • emitClose

        public void emitClose()

      • getReadyState

        public Transport.READY_STATE getReadyState()
        Current state of the connection
